content.description: Sit start with shallow left hand hueco a right hand sidepull-pinch. From there, using a right heel hook, pull up to right hand edge, follow to a jug left hand, then finish up the remainder for an easy mantel.
content.protection: A pad will work. The landing is perfect.
content.location: It climbs the west section of Hobbiton's north face.

content.description: Sit start with a right hand edge and a left hand sidepull-sloper. From there, pull up to a right hand incut edge, follow to a great left hand sidepull, then traverse right using another left hand sidepull and right hand edge, eventually gain a right hand pinch-edge, match a left hand next to it on an edge, bring the feet along, stick the lip, and mantel atop the boulder.
content.protection: A pair of pads. It has a fantastic landing though.
content.location: It climbs the center of Hobbiton's north face.

content.description: Sit start with a right hand on the arete and a left hand incut edge. From there, pull up to left hand edge, follow with a big right hand to the jug above, match on it, and finish up the remainder for a casual finish.
content.protection: A pair of pads. There are a few minor rocks in the landing, but pads make it all go away.
content.location: It climbs the center arete located on Hobbiton's north face.

content.description: Sit start with hands matched on an obvious edge. From there, work right along the arete on sharp, small edges, place a heel on the start hold, gain the better edges above, then finish up the remaining highly features face for an easy finish.
content.protection: A pair of pads. There is a great landing.
content.location: It climbs the east section, or northeast arete of Hobbiton.

content.description: Sit start with right hand edge and a left hand sloper-sidepull. From there, climb straight up the dihedral using an assortment of edges, sidepulls, and gastons to reach a dynamic finish to the jug on top with an easy mantel.
content.protection: A pair of pads. A few minor rocks that are easily padded.
content.location: It climbs the north facing dihedral on Hobbiton's north face.
